const post = {
  id: "openFOI",
  title: "OpenFOI: Freedom of Information Made Easy",
  publication: "Portfolio, 2025",
  date: "2025-05-28",
  summary: "An AI-powered platform for managing Freedom of Information requests.",
  video: "/videos/OpenFOI.mp4",
  content: `


    ## OpenFOI
    Freedom of Information (FOI) requests are vital for transparency and accountability ‚Äî yet responding to them remains manually intensive and error-prone. OpenFOI is a streamlined, AI-powered tool for managing FOI workflows end-to-end. Built for journalists, public officials, and civil society organizations, it simplifies response drafting, redaction, export, and request tracking ‚Äî all in a single interface.
    
    ### Features
    üß† GPT-powered response drafting with integrated FOI exemptions  
    ‚úÇÔ∏è Manual and rule-based redaction with exemption tagging  
    üîê Blackout-style redacted PDF + styled DOCX export  
    üì• CSV upload for batch request ingestion  
    üóÉÔ∏è Request tracker with metadata, reference numbers, and response history  
    üì§ Session-based state saving for seamless navigation  
    ‚öôÔ∏è Customisable exemptions system compliant with UK FOI Act 2000
    
    ### Technologies Used
    Streamlit ‚Äì lightweight frontend for rapid UI development  
    Python ‚Äì core backend logic and redaction tools  
    OpenAI GPT-4 ‚Äì for AI-assisted response generation and suggestions  
    spaCy ‚Äì used optionally for named entity recognition (NER)  
    FPDF + python-docx ‚Äì for redacted PDF and styled DOCX exports
    
    ## Reflections
    OpenFOI was built to explore how small civic tools can harness AI responsibly in high-stakes, bureaucratic domains. Working on it strengthened my understanding of document workflows, sensitive redaction logic, and user-centric design in the public sector. It‚Äôs a simple, extensible base for bringing machine learning to government transparency.
    


  `
};
export default post;

sourcesContent:
const post = {
    id: "openFOI",
    title: "OpenFOI: Freedom of Information Made Easy",
    publication: "Portfolio, 2025",
    date: "2025-05-28",
    summary: "An AI-powered platform for managing Freedom of Information requests.",
    video: "/videos/OpenFOI.mp4",
    content: `


    ## OpenFOI
    Freedom of Information (FOI) requests are vital for transparency and accountability ‚Äî yet responding to them remains manually intensive and error-prone. OpenFOI is a streamlined, AI-powered tool for managing FOI workflows end-to-end. Built for journalists, public officials, and civil society organizations, it simplifies response drafting, redaction, export, and request tracking ‚Äî all in a single interface.
    
    ### Features
    üß† GPT-powered response drafting with integrated FOI exemptions  
    ‚úÇÔ∏è Manual and rule-based redaction with exemption tagging  
    üîê Blackout-style redacted PDF + styled DOCX export  
    üì• CSV upload for batch request ingestion  
    üóÉÔ∏è Request tracker with metadata, reference numbers, and response history  
    üì§ Session-based state saving for seamless navigation  
    ‚öôÔ∏è Customisable exemptions system compliant with UK FOI Act 2000
    
    ### Technologies Used
    Streamlit ‚Äì lightweight frontend for rapid UI development  
    Python ‚Äì core backend logic and redaction tools  
    OpenAI GPT-4 ‚Äì for AI-assisted response generation and suggestions  
    spaCy ‚Äì used optionally for named entity recognition (NER)  
    FPDF + python-docx ‚Äì for redacted PDF and styled DOCX exports
    
    ## Reflections
    OpenFOI was built to explore how small civic tools can harness AI responsibly in high-stakes, bureaucratic domains. Working on it strengthened my understanding of document workflows, sensitive redaction logic, and user-centric design in the public sector. It‚Äôs a simple, extensible base for bringing machine learning to government transparency.
    


  `
  };
  
  export default post;
